Key Match Events: Dylan Cease pitched a perfect game with 103 pitches before allowing a single to right field by Jason Heyward to open the sixth.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado homered twice for the Padres, contributing significantly to the team's victory.
Padres manager Mike Shildt called Cease 'dominant' and 'outstanding'.
Manny Machado stated that beating a good club like the Astros is fun and they are playing good baseball.
Padres are closing in on their third playoff berth since 2020.
Manager Mike Shildt mentioned that the atmosphere at Petco Park was 'playoff-caliber'.
If the Astros and Padres meet again, it will be in the World Series according to Machado.
Miscellaneous Highlights: San Diego Padres won 4-0 against the AL West-leading Houston Astros.
Dylan Cease threw his first career no-hitter on July 25 at Washington.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a homer in the eighth inning.
Donovan Solano also hit a homer in the eighth inning.
Jason Heyward hit a single to right field to end Cease's no-hit bid in the sixth inning.
